001/**
002 * CeceCandiCornerGUI.java
003 * This version has been updated to include JavaFX GUI compatibility (FKA CeceCandiCornerApp.java)
004 * This is the main JavaFX application class for Cece's Candi Corner Inventory Management System.
005 * It provides a graphical user interface for the user to interact with the InventoryManager.
006 * This class handles all UI elements, user input, and displays results,
007 * interacting with the InventoryManager for business logic.
008 * Role in System: This class serves as the primary user interface for the inventory system,
009 * allowing users to perform all CRUD operations and generate reports through a graphical window.
010 * It initializes the database connection and the core inventory management logic.
011 * Usage Example:
012 * To run the application, execute its main method. It will prompt for a database file path.
013 * @author Teddy Jones
014 * @author CEN3024C
015 * @author Professor Evans
016 */
017package com.cececandicorner.inventory; // IMPORTANT: Ensure this matches your package name
018
019import javafx.application.Application;
020import javafx.application.Platform;
021import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
022import javafx.collections.ObservableList;
023import javafx.geometry.Insets;
024import javafx.geometry.Pos;
025import javafx.scene.Scene;
026import javafx.scene.control.*;
027import javafx.scene.control.cell.PropertyValueFactory;
028import javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane;
029import javafx.scene.layout.GridPane;
030import javafx.scene.layout.VBox;
031import javafx.stage.Stage;
032
033import java.util.List;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.Base64; // Import for Base64 encoding
036
037
038/**
039 * This class acts as the main view and controller, which translates user actions from buttons and dialogs
040 * into method calls to the InventoryManager, which contains the core business logic. This class uses JavaFX
041 * properties in the Bracelet class to enable automatic updates to the inventory table.
042 */
043public class CeceCandiCornerGUI extends Application {
044
045    private InventoryManager inventoryManager;
046    private TableView<Bracelet> inventoryTable;
047    private TextArea messageArea; // For displaying general messages and reports
048    private ObservableList<Bracelet> braceletData; // The ObservableList backing the TableView
049    private Stage primaryStage; // Keep a reference to the primary stage
050
051    // NEW: Currency symbol for display
052    private String currentCurrencySymbol = "$"; // Default to USD
053
054    // FIX: Declare currencySelector as a class field so it's accessible throughout the class
055    private ComboBox<String> currencySelector;
056
057    @Override
058    public void start(Stage primaryStage) {
059        this.primaryStage = primaryStage; // Store reference to primary stage
060
061        // --- FIX: Initialize braceletData BEFORE any call to updateInventoryTable() ---
062        braceletData = FXCollections.observableArrayList();
063
064        // Prompt user for database file path at startup
065        String dbFilePath = promptForDatabasePath();
066        if (dbFilePath == null) {
067            showMessage("Database path not provided or cancelled. Application will exit.");
068            Platform.exit();
069            return;
070        }
071
072        // Initialize DatabaseManager and then InventoryManager
073        DatabaseManager dbManager = new DatabaseManager(dbFilePath);
074        inventoryManager = new InventoryManager(dbManager);
075
076        primaryStage.setTitle("Cece's Candi Corner Inventory Management System (Connected to: " + dbFilePath + ")");
077
078        // --- UI Elements ---
079        messageArea = new TextArea();
080        messageArea.setEditable(false);
081        messageArea.setWrapText(true);
082        messageArea.setPrefHeight(100); // Set a preferred height for the message area
083
084        // Inventory Table
085        inventoryTable = new TableView<>();
086        inventoryTable.setPlaceholder(new Label("No bracelets to display. Connect to database and display."));
087        inventoryTable.setItems(braceletData); // Link the TableView to the ObservableList
088
089        // --- IMPORTANT: Using property() methods for PropertyValueFactory ---
090        // This ensures the TableView observes the observable properties in Bracelet.java
091        TableColumn<Bracelet, String> idCol = new TableColumn<>("ID");
092        idCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("id")); // Looks for idProperty()
093        idCol.setPrefWidth(80);
094
095        TableColumn<Bracelet, String> descCol = new TableColumn<>("Description");
096        descCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("description")); // Looks for descriptionProperty()
097        descCol.setPrefWidth(180);
098
099        TableColumn<Bracelet, Integer> quantityCol = new TableColumn<>("Quantity");
100        quantityCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("quantity")); // Looks for quantityProperty()
101        quantityCol.setPrefWidth(90);
102
103        // NEW: Custom cell factory for price formatting
104        TableColumn<Bracelet, Double> priceCol = new TableColumn<>("Price");
105        priceCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("price")); // Still links to priceProperty()
106        priceCol.setCellFactory(column -> new TableCell<Bracelet, Double>() {
107            @Override
108            protected void updateItem(Double item, boolean empty) {
109                super.updateItem(item, empty);
110                if (empty || item == null) {
111                    setText(null);
112                } else {
113                    setText(formatPrice(item)); // Use the new formatPrice helper
114                }
115            }
116        });
117        priceCol.setPrefWidth(90);
118
119        TableColumn<Bracelet, String> statusCol = new TableColumn<>("Status");
120        statusCol.setCellValueFactory(new PropertyValueFactory<>("status")); // Looks for statusProperty()
121        statusCol.setPrefWidth(100);
122        // --- END IMPORTANT CHANGE ---
123
124        inventoryTable.getColumns().addAll(idCol, descCol, quantityCol, priceCol, statusCol);
125        inventoryTable.setColumnResizePolicy(TableView.CONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY); // Make columns fill width
126
127        // --- Buttons for Main Operations ---
128        // Removed "Load Data from File"
129        Button displayAllButton = new Button("Display All Bracelets");
130        displayAllButton.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
131        displayAllButton.setOnAction(e -> handleDisplayAll());
132
133        Button addBraceletButton = new Button("Add New Bracelet");
134        addBraceletButton.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
135        addBraceletButton.setOnAction(e -> showAddBraceletDialog());
136
137        Button removeBraceletButton = new Button("Remove Bracelet");
138        removeBraceletButton.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
139        removeBraceletButton.setOnAction(e -> showRemoveBraceletDialog());
140
141        Button updateBraceletButton = new Button("Update Bracelet");
142        updateBraceletButton.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
143        updateBraceletButton.setOnAction(e -> showUpdateBraceletDialog());
144
145        Button lowStockReportButton = new Button("Generate Low Stock Report");
146        lowStockReportButton.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
147        lowStockReportButton.setOnAction(e -> showLowStockReportDialog());
148
149        Button exitButton = new Button("Exit");
150        exitButton.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
151        exitButton.setOnAction(e -> Platform.exit()); // Exit the application
152
153        // FIX: Initialize currencySelector BEFORE it's added to the VBox
154        currencySelector = new ComboBox<>(FXCollections.observableArrayList("$ (USD)", "C$ (CAD)", "¥ (CNY)", "¥ (JPY)"));
155        currencySelector.setValue("$ (USD)"); // Default selection
156        currencySelector.setMaxWidth(Double.MAX_VALUE);
157        currencySelector.setOnAction(e -> {
158            String selected = currencySelector.getValue();
159            switch (selected) {
160                case "$ (USD)": currentCurrencySymbol = "$"; break;
161                case "C$ (CAD)": currentCurrencySymbol = "C$"; break;
162                case "¥ (CNY)": currentCurrencySymbol = "¥"; break; // CNY and JPY use same symbol
163                case "¥ (JPY)": currentCurrencySymbol = "¥"; break;
164                default: currentCurrencySymbol = "$"; // Fallback
165            }
166            updateInventoryTable(); // Refresh table to show new currency symbol
167            // If update dialog is open, its price label won't update automatically.
168            // For this scope, we'll assume the dialog is closed or user re-opens it.
169        });
170
171
172        VBox buttonLayout = new VBox(10, displayAllButton, addBraceletButton,
173                removeBraceletButton, updateBraceletButton, lowStockReportButton, currencySelector, exitButton); // Added currencySelector
174        buttonLayout.setPadding(new Insets(10));
175        buttonLayout.setAlignment(Pos.TOP_CENTER);
176
177        // --- Main Layout ---
178        BorderPane root = new BorderPane();
179        root.setPadding(new Insets(10));
180        root.setLeft(buttonLayout); // Buttons on the left
181        root.setCenter(inventoryTable); // Table in the center
182        root.setBottom(messageArea); // Message area at the bottom
183
184        // Initial display of inventory (now braceletData is initialized)
185        updateInventoryTable(); // Call to populate table from DB on startup
186
187        Scene scene = new Scene(root, 900, 600); // Increased width for better layout
188
189        // --- Apply Dark Mode CSS ---
190        String darkModeCss =
191                ".root {" +
192                        "    -fx-background-color: #2b2b2b;" + /* Dark background */
193                        "}" +
194                        ".button {" +
195                        "    -fx-background-color: #4a4a4a;" +
196                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" +
197                        "    -fx-background-radius: 5;" +
198                        "    -fx-border-radius: 5;" +
199                        "    -fx-border-color: #6a6a6a;" +
200                        "}" +
201                        ".button:hover {" +
202                        "    -fx-background-color: #5a5a5a;" +
203                        "}" +
204                        ".label {" +
205                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" + /* Light text for labels */
206                        "}" +
207                        ".text-area {" +
208                        "    -fx-control-inner-background: #3c3c3c;" + /* Darker background for text area */
209                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" +
210                        "    -fx-highlight-fill: #007bff;" +
211                        "    -fx-highlight-text-fill: #ffffff;" +
212                        "}" +
213                        ".table-view {" +
214                        "    -fx-base: #3c3c3c;" + /* Base color for table */
215                        "    -fx-control-inner-background: #3c3c3c;" +
216                        "    -fx-background-color: #3c3c3c;" +
217                        "    -fx-table-cell-border-color: #5a5a5a;" +
218                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" +
219                        "}" +
220                        ".table-view .column-header-background {" +
221                        "    -fx-background-color: #4a4a4a;" +
222                        "}" +
223                        ".table-view .column-header .label {" +
224                        "    -fx-text-fill: #ffffff;" +
225                        "}" +
226                        ".table-row-cell {" +
227                        "    -fx-background-color: -fx-table-cell-border-color, #3c3c3c;" +
228                        "    -fx-background-insets: 0, 0 0 1 0;" +
229                        "    -fx-padding: 0;" +
230                        "}" +
231                        ".table-row-cell:odd {" +
232                        "    -fx-background-color: -fx-table-cell-border-color, #424242;" +
233                        "}" +
234                        ".table-row-cell:selected {" +
235                        "    -fx-background-color: #007bff;" +
236                        "    -fx-text-fill: #ffffff;" +
237                        "}" +
238                        ".text-field {" +
239                        "    -fx-control-inner-background: #3c3c3c;" +
240                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" +
241                        "    -fx-prompt-text-fill: #a0a0a0;" +
242                        "    -fx-background-radius: 5;" +
243                        "    -fx-border-radius: 5;" +
244                        "    -fx-border-color: #6a6a6a;" +
245                        "}" +
246                        ".combo-box {" +
247                        "    -fx-background-color: #3c3c3c;" +
248                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" +
249                        "    -fx-background-radius: 5;" +
250                        "    -fx-border-radius: 5;" +
251                        "    -fx-border-color: #6a6a6a;" +
252                        "}" +
253                        ".combo-box .list-cell {" +
254                        "    -fx-background-color: #3c3c3c;" +
255                        "    -fx-text-fill: #e0e0e0;" +
256                        "}" +
257                        ".combo-box .list-cell:filled:selected, .combo-box .list-cell:filled:selected:hover {" +
258                        "    -fx-background-color: #007bff;" +
259                        "    -fx-text-fill: #ffffff;" +
260                        "}" +
261                        ".combo-box .list-cell:filled:hover {" +
262                        "    -fx-background-color: #5a5a5a;" +
263                        "}";
264
265        scene.getStylesheets().add("data:text/css;base64," + Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(darkModeCss.getBytes()));
266        // --- End Apply Dark Mode CSS ---
267
268        primaryStage.setScene(scene);
269        primaryStage.show();
270    }
271
272    /**
273     * Prompts the user to select or enter the path to the SQLite database file.
274     * @return The absolute path to the database file, or null if cancelled/invalid.
275     */
276    private String promptForDatabasePath() {
277        TextInputDialog dialog = new TextInputDialog("inventory.db"); // Default suggestion
278        dialog.setTitle("Database Connection");
279        dialog.setHeaderText("Enter the path to your SQLite database file:");
280        dialog.setContentText("Database File Path:");
281
282        Optional<String> result = dialog.showAndWait();
283        if (result.isPresent()) {
284            String path = result.get().trim();
285            if (path.isEmpty()) {
286                showMessage("Database path cannot be empty.");
287                return null;
288            }
289            // Optional: Basic validation to check if it looks like a file path
290            // For robust validation, you might try to connect here and catch SQLException
291            return path;
292        }
293        return null; // User cancelled
294    }
295
296    /**
297     * Handles displaying all bracelets currently in the inventory.
298     */
299    private void handleDisplayAll() {
300        updateInventoryTable();
301        if (inventoryManager.getInventory().isEmpty()) {
302            showMessage("Inventory is empty. No data to display.");
303        } else {
304            showMessage("Displaying all bracelets in inventory.");
305        }
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Updates the TableView with the current inventory data from InventoryManager.
310     * This method now uses setAll() to replace all elements in the ObservableList,
311     * which can be more efficient and reliable for triggering UI updates.
312     */
313    private void updateInventoryTable() {
314        braceletData.setAll(inventoryManager.getInventory()); // Use setAll to replace all elements
315        inventoryTable.refresh(); // Explicitly tell the table to refresh its view
316    }
317
318    /**
319     * Displays a message to the user in the message area.
320     * @param message The message to display.
321     */
322    private void showMessage(String message) {
323        messageArea.setText(message);
324    }
325
326    /**
327     * Helper method to format price based on the current currency symbol and rules.
328     * @param price The price value.
329     * @return Formatted price string (e.g., "$30", "$30.50").
330     */
331    private String formatPrice(Double price) {
332        if (price == null) {
333            return "";
334        }
335        // Check if it's a whole number (e.g., 30.0)
336        if (price == Math.floor(price)) {
337            return currentCurrencySymbol + String.format("%.0f", price); // Display as $30
338        } else {
339            // Display with two decimal places, e.g., $30.50
340            return currentCurrencySymbol + String.format("%.2f", price);
341        }
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Shows a dialog for adding a new bracelet.
346     */
347    private void showAddBraceletDialog() {
348        Dialog<ButtonType> dialog = new Dialog<>();
349        dialog.setTitle("Add New Bracelet");
350        dialog.setHeaderText("Enter details for the new bracelet:");
351
352        // Set the button types.
353        // FIX: Corrected ButtonType usage to explicitly create ButtonType with ButtonBar.ButtonData.OK_DONE
354        ButtonType addButtonType = new ButtonType("OK", ButtonBar.ButtonData.OK_DONE); // Corrected line
355        dialog.getDialogPane().getButtonTypes().addAll(addButtonType, ButtonType.CANCEL);
356
357        GridPane grid = new GridPane();
358        grid.setHgap(10);
359        grid.setVgap(10);
360        grid.setPadding(new Insets(20, 150, 10, 10));
361
362        TextField idField = new TextField();
363        idField.setPromptText("ID");
364        TextField descriptionField = new TextField();
365        descriptionField.setPromptText("Description");
366        TextField quantityField = new TextField();
367        quantityField.setPromptText("Quantity");
368        TextField priceField = new TextField();
369        priceField.setPromptText("Price");
370
371        grid.add(new Label("ID:"), 0, 0);
372        grid.add(idField, 1, 0);
373        grid.add(new Label("Description:"), 0, 1);
374        grid.add(descriptionField, 1, 1);
375        grid.add(new Label("Quantity:"), 0, 2);
376        grid.add(quantityField, 1, 2);
377        grid.add(new Label("Price:"), 0, 3);
378        grid.add(priceField, 1, 3);
379
380        dialog.getDialogPane().setContent(grid);
381
382        // Request focus on the ID field by default.
383        Platform.runLater(() -> idField.requestFocus());
384
385        dialog.setResultConverter(dialogButton -> {
386            if (dialogButton == addButtonType) {
387                String id = idField.getText().trim();
388                String description = descriptionField.getText().trim();
389                String quantityStr = quantityField.getText().trim();
390                String priceStr = priceField.getText().trim();
391
392                String result = inventoryManager.addBracelet(id, description, quantityStr, priceStr);
393                showMessage(result);
394                updateInventoryTable(); // Refresh table
395            }
396            return null;
397        });
398
399        dialog.showAndWait();
400    }
401
402    /**
403     * Shows a dialog for removing an existing bracelet.
404     */
405    private void showRemoveBraceletDialog() {
406        TextInputDialog dialog = new TextInputDialog();
407        dialog.setTitle("Remove Bracelet");
408        dialog.setHeaderText("Enter the ID of the bracelet to remove:");
409        dialog.setContentText("Bracelet ID:");
410
411        Optional<String> result = dialog.showAndWait();
412        result.ifPresent(itemId -> {
413            // --- NEW: Confirmation Alert for Deletion ---
414            Alert confirmationAlert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.CONFIRMATION);
415            confirmationAlert.setTitle("Confirm Deletion");
416            confirmationAlert.setHeaderText("You are about to permanently delete bracelet with ID: " + itemId);
417            confirmationAlert.setContentText("This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to proceed?");
418
419            Optional<ButtonType> confirmationResult = confirmationAlert.showAndWait();
420            if (confirmationResult.isPresent() && confirmationResult.get() == ButtonType.OK) {
421                String message = inventoryManager.removeBracelet(itemId.trim());
422                showMessage(message);
423                updateInventoryTable(); // Refresh table
424            } else {
425                showMessage("Deletion of bracelet " + itemId + " cancelled.");
426            }
427            // --- END NEW ---
428        });
429    }
430
431    /**
432     * Shows a dialog for updating an existing bracelet.
433     */
434    private void showUpdateBraceletDialog() {
435        TextInputDialog idDialog = new TextInputDialog();
436        idDialog.setTitle("Update Bracelet");
437        idDialog.setHeaderText("Enter the ID of the bracelet to update:");
438        // FIX: Corrected line. This was a typo, referring to 'dialog' instead of 'idDialog'.
439        idDialog.setContentText("Bracelet ID:"); // Corrected line
440
441        Optional<String> idResult = idDialog.showAndWait();
442        idResult.ifPresent(itemId -> {
443            String id = itemId.trim();
444            Bracelet braceletToUpdate = inventoryManager.getBraceletById(id);
445
446            if (braceletToUpdate == null) {
447                showMessage(String.format("Error: Bracelet with ID '%s' not found.", id));
448                return;
449            }
450
451            // If bracelet found, show update options
452            Dialog<ButtonType> updateDialog = new Dialog<>();
453            updateDialog.setTitle("Update Bracelet Details");
454            updateDialog.setHeaderText(String.format("Updating Bracelet: %s\nCurrent Details: %s\nSelect field(s) to update:", braceletToUpdate.getDescription(), braceletToUpdate.toString()));
455
456            // FIX: Corrected ButtonType usage. Creating ButtonType explicitly with text and ButtonBar.ButtonData.OK_DONE
457            ButtonType updateButtonType = new ButtonType("OK", ButtonBar.ButtonData.OK_DONE); // Corrected line
458            updateDialog.getDialogPane().getButtonTypes().addAll(updateButtonType, ButtonType.CANCEL);
459
460            GridPane grid = new GridPane();
461            grid.setHgap(10);
462            grid.setVgap(10);
463            grid.setPadding(new Insets(20, 150, 10, 10));
464
465            Label currentQuantityLabel = new Label("Current Quantity: " + braceletToUpdate.getQuantity());
466            TextField newQuantityField = new TextField();
467            newQuantityField.setPromptText("New Quantity");
468
469            // NEW: Use formatPrice helper for current price display
470            Label currentPriceLabel = new Label("Current Price: " + formatPrice(braceletToUpdate.getPrice()));
471            TextField newPriceField = new TextField();
472            newPriceField.setPromptText("New Price");
473
474            Label currentStatusLabel = new Label("Current Status: " + braceletToUpdate.getStatus());
475            ComboBox<String> newStatusComboBox = new ComboBox<>(FXCollections.observableArrayList("In Stock", "Out of Stock"));
476            newStatusComboBox.setValue(braceletToUpdate.getStatus()); // Set current status as default
477
478            grid.add(new Label("Quantity:"), 0, 0);
479            grid.add(currentQuantityLabel, 1, 0);
480            grid.add(newQuantityField, 2, 0);
481
482            grid.add(new Label("Price:"), 0, 1);
483            grid.add(currentPriceLabel, 1, 1);
484            grid.add(newPriceField, 2, 1);
485
486            grid.add(new Label("Status:"), 0, 2);
487            grid.add(currentStatusLabel, 1, 2);
488            grid.add(newStatusComboBox, 2, 2);
489
490            updateDialog.getDialogPane().setContent(grid);
491
492            updateDialog.setResultConverter(dialogButton -> {
493                if (dialogButton == updateButtonType) {
494                    String message = "";
495                    boolean quantityUpdated = false; // Flag to track if quantity was updated
496                    boolean statusUpdatedManually = false; // Flag to track if status was called in InventoryManager
497
498                    // Store original quantity and status for comparison
499                    int originalQuantity = braceletToUpdate.getQuantity();
500                    String originalStatus = braceletToUpdate.getStatus();
501
502                    // 1. Handle Quantity Update FIRST
503                    String newQuantityStr = newQuantityField.getText().trim();
504                    if (!newQuantityStr.isEmpty()) {
505                        // Attempt to update quantity, this will also trigger auto-status change if applicable
506                        message = inventoryManager.updateBracelet(id, "quantity", newQuantityStr);
507                        showMessage(message);
508                        quantityUpdated = true;
509                    }
510
511                    // 2. Handle Manual Status Update (with confirmation and quantity override)
512                    String selectedStatus = newStatusComboBox.getValue();
513                    // Check if a status was explicitly selected AND it's different from the bracelet's *current* status
514                    // after potential quantity update.
515                    // IMPORTANT: We only allow manual status update if quantity didn't already force it.
516                    if (selectedStatus != null && !selectedStatus.equalsIgnoreCase(braceletToUpdate.getStatus())) {
517                        // Special handling if user tries to manually set to "Out of Stock" when quantity is > 0
518                        if (selectedStatus.equalsIgnoreCase("Out of Stock") && braceletToUpdate.getQuantity() > 0) {
519                            Alert confirmationAlert = new Alert(Alert.AlertType.CONFIRMATION);
520                            confirmationAlert.setTitle("Confirm Status Change");
521                            confirmationAlert.setHeaderText("Changing status to 'Out of Stock' will set quantity to 0.");
522                            confirmationAlert.setContentText("Are you sure you want to proceed?");
523
524                            Optional<ButtonType> confirmationResult = confirmationAlert.showAndWait();
525                            if (confirmationResult.isPresent() && confirmationResult.get() == ButtonType.OK) {
526                                // User confirmed: Set quantity to 0 first, then set status
527                                String qtyUpdateResult = inventoryManager.updateBracelet(id, "quantity", "0");
528                                showMessage(qtyUpdateResult); // Show message for quantity update
529                                message = inventoryManager.updateBracelet(id, "status", "Out of Stock");
530                                showMessage(message); // Show message for status update
531                                statusUpdatedManually = true;
532                            } else {
533                                showMessage("Status change to 'Out of Stock' cancelled. Status remains: " + braceletToUpdate.getStatus());
534                                // Do not proceed with status update
535                            }
536                        }
537                        // Handle manual status change that contradicts quantity (already handled by InventoryManager, but let's be explicit here for GUI feedback)
538                        else if ((braceletToUpdate.getQuantity() == 0 && selectedStatus.equalsIgnoreCase("In Stock")) ||
539                                (braceletToUpdate.getQuantity() > 0 && selectedStatus.equalsIgnoreCase("Out of Stock") && !selectedStatus.equalsIgnoreCase(originalStatus))) { // If quantity is 0 and trying to set In Stock, or quantity > 0 and trying to set Out of Stock (and it wasn't already)
540                            showMessage("Warning: Status cannot be manually set to contradict current quantity. Status remains: " + braceletToUpdate.getStatus());
541                            // Do NOT update status if it contradicts the quantity rule
542                        }
543                        else {
544                            message = inventoryManager.updateBracelet(id, "status", selectedStatus);
545                            showMessage(message);
546                            statusUpdatedManually = true;
547                        }
548                    }
549
550                    // 3. Handle Price Update (after quantity and status to ensure latest state)
551                    String newPriceStr = newPriceField.getText().trim();
552                    if (!newPriceStr.isEmpty()) {
553                        message = inventoryManager.updateBracelet(id, "price", newPriceStr);
554                        showMessage(message);
555                    }
556
557                    // Final check to see if any actual changes were made by user input
558                    if (!quantityUpdated && !statusUpdatedManually && newPriceStr.isEmpty()) {
559                        showMessage("No changes made to bracelet " + id + ".");
560                    }
561                    updateInventoryTable(); // Refresh table after all potential updates
562                }
563                return null;
564            });
565            updateDialog.showAndWait();
566        });
567    }
568
569    /**
570     * Shows a dialog for generating a low stock report.
571     */
572    private void showLowStockReportDialog() {
573        TextInputDialog dialog = new TextInputDialog();
574        dialog.setTitle("Low Stock Report");
575        dialog.setHeaderText("Enter the low stock threshold quantity:");
576        dialog.setContentText("Threshold:");
577
578        Optional<String> result = dialog.showAndWait();
579        result.ifPresent(thresholdStr -> {
580            List<Bracelet> lowStockItems = inventoryManager.generateLowStockReport(thresholdStr.trim());
581
582            if (lowStockItems == null) {
583                showMessage("Error: Threshold must be a valid non-negative integer.");
584            } else if (lowStockItems.isEmpty()) {
585                showMessage(String.format("No bracelets currently below the specified stock threshold of %s.", thresholdStr));
586            } else {
587                StringBuilder report = new StringBuilder();
588                report.append(String.format("--- Bracelets Below Stock Threshold (%s) ---\n", thresholdStr));
589                for (Bracelet bracelet : lowStockItems) {
590                    report.append(String.format("ID: %s, Description: %s, Current Quantity: %d\n",
591                            bracelet.getId(), bracelet.getDescription(), bracelet.getQuantity()));
592                }
593                report.append("-------------------------------------------------------\n");
594                showMessage(report.toString());
595            }
596        });
597    }
598
599    /**
600     * This is the main entry point for the application.
601     * This method starts the JavaFX runtime and launches the application by calling the {@link Application#launch(String...)} method, which then in turn
602     * creates an instances of this class while also calling the {@link #start(Stage)} method.
603     * @param args Command-line arguments passed to the application (none currently used).
604     */
605    public static void main(String[] args) {
606        launch(args);
607    }
608}
